original: @7a * // gsang ldan gyi dka' 'grel don bsdus sgron ma bzhugs /
analyzed: @7a * // gsang ldan gyi dka' 'grel don bsdus sgron ma bzhugs /
translated: The Lamp of the Summary of the Meaning, a Commentary on the Guhyasamaja

original: # // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: # // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Bhagavat, the youthful Manjushri.

original: thugs rje dang ni shes rab gnyis //
analyzed: thugs rje dang ni shes rab gnyis //
translated: Compassion and wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas kun ltar gnyis med pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ltar gnyis med pa //
translated: nondual like all buddhas,

original: dam pa @7b lam ston lta bu yi //
analyzed: dam pa @7b lam ston lta bu yi //
translated: like a guide on the path,

original: sku yi rnam par 'char mdzad pa //
analyzed: sku yi rnam par 'char mdzad pa //
translated: arises in the form🔽of Manjushri.

original: 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to him.🔽In order that the disciple may understand well and

original: slob mas legs par rtogs phyir dang // bdag nyid kyis kyang dran bya'i phyir //
analyzed: slob mas legs par rtogs phyir dang // bdag nyid kyis kyang dran bya'i phyir //
translated: in order that I may remember,

original: gsang ldan dka' 'grel 'dir brtsam bya //
analyzed: gsang ldan dka' 'grel 'dir brtsam bya //
translated: I will compose this commentary on the Guhyasamaja.

original: de nas dkyus nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyus nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Now I will enter into the actual text.

original: gang 'di la sogs ba'i tshig rkang pa bzhis mchod par brjod pa ston te /
analyzed: gang 'di la sogs ba'i tshig rkang pa bzhis mchod par brjod pa ston te /
translated: The four lines beginning with “Whatever” teach the expression of worship.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal nyid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo nyid du bzhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal nyid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo nyid du bzhugs pa yin la /
translated: The noble Manjushri himself abides as the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas.

original: de la slob dpon nyid lus ngag yid gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal ba ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob dpon nyid lus ngag yid gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal ba ba stan pa'o //
translated: In that, the master himself respectfully prostrates with body, speech, and mind.

original: zab cing la sogs pa rkang pa bzhis bshad par dam bca' ba ston te /
analyzed: zab cing la sogs pa rkang pa bzhis bshad par dam bca' ba ston te /
translated: The four lines beginning with “profound” show the promise to explain.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi zab cing rgya che ba'i mtshan /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi zab cing rgya che ba'i mtshan /
translated: The name of Ārya Mañjuśrī is profound and vast.

original: rnal 'byor spyi'i rgyud la brten nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyi'i rgyud la brten nas /
translated: Based on the yoga tantra,

original: gzhan dbang bdag gi don du 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang bdag gi don du 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad pa'o //
translated: it is explained for the benefit of others.

original: thig le bcu drug mi shig pa dbus la sogs pa rkang pa bcu drug gis gang la zhus pa dang ; gang gis zhus pa dang / gang gi don du zhus pa ston pa las /
analyzed: thig le bcu drug mi shig pa dbus la sogs pa rkang pa bcu drug gis gang la zhus pa dang ; gang gis zhus pa dang / gang gi don du zhus pa ston pa las /
translated: The sixteen bindus, the indestructible, the center, and so on, with sixteen lines, show the questioner, the one who asks, and the purpose of the question.

original: gang la zhus na sku gsum la zhus pa ston te /
analyzed: gang la zhus na sku gsum la zhus pa ston te /
translated: If it is asked to whom it is asked, it shows that it is asked to the three kāyas.

original: thig le la sogs pa rkang pa bdun gyis chos sku ba stan /🔽gsang sngags la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyis longs sku ba stan la /
analyzed: thig le la sogs pa rkang pa bdun gyis chos sku ba stan / gsang sngags la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyis longs sku ba stan la /
translated: The seven lines beginning with “bindu” show the dharmakāya.🔽The two lines beginning with “secret mantra” show the sambhogakāya.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyis sprul sku ba stan nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyis sprul sku ba stan nas /
translated: The two lines beginning with “buddha” show the nirmāṇakāya.

original: byang chub la sogs pa rkang pa bzhis gang gis zhus pa ston cing /
analyzed: byang chub la sogs pa rkang pa bzhis gang gis zhus pa ston cing /
translated: The four lines beginning with “enlightenment” show who asked.

original: blo zhan don phyir rim pa gsungs //
analyzed: blo zhan don phyir rim pa gsungs //
translated: For the sake of those of lesser intellect, the stages were taught.

original: zhes pa rkang pa gcig gis gang gi don du zhus pa ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rkang pa gcig gis gang gi don du zhus pa ba stan pa'o //
translated: The one line beginning with “for the sake” shows for whose sake it was asked.

original: de ltar glang kyi don ba stan nas gzhung la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar glang kyi don ba stan nas gzhung la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Having thus shown the meaning of the introduction, one should enter the text.

original: gang gis gang du thabs ji ltar bya ba dang gsum du gnas pa las /
analyzed: gang gis gang du thabs ji ltar bya ba dang gsum du gnas pa las /
translated: It is presented in three parts: by whom, where, and how the method is to be performed.🔽Of those,

original: de la / dang por rdo rje 'chang chen por //
analyzed: de la / dang por rdo rje 'chang chen por //
translated: first, having become a master of the great vajra holder,

original: slob dpon cha lugs gnas byas te //
analyzed: slob dpon cha lugs gnas byas te //
translated: one should perform the ritual master’s attire and place.

original: zhes pa rkang pa gnyis kyis gang zag gang gis bya ba ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa rkang pa gnyis kyis gang zag gang gis bya ba ston te /
translated: The two lines beginning with “first” show the person by whom it is to be performed.

original: slob dpon rig pa'i gnas lnga la sbyangs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon rig pa'i gnas lnga la sbyangs pa /
translated: The ritual master is trained in the five sciences.

original: de nyid bcu shes shing 'jigs pa med pas /
analyzed: de nyid bcu shes shing 'jigs pa med pas /
translated: Knowing the ten principles, he is fearless.

original: cha rkyen lnga dang ldan par bya ste ;
analyzed: cha rkyen lnga dang ldan par bya ste ;
translated: He should have the five attributes.

original: phyi nang gi khrus dang / phyi nang gi bsrung ba dang / phyi nang gi gos bgo ba dang / phyi nang gi byug pa dang / gnas dang stan sngags chus bsangs la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi khrus dang / phyi nang gi bsrung ba dang / phyi nang gi gos bgo ba dang / phyi nang gi byug pa dang / gnas dang stan sngags chus bsangs la 'dug pa'o //
translated: external and internal bathing, external and internal protection, external and internal clothing, external and internal anointing, and sitting on a place and seat that have been purified with mantra water.

original: bsam gtan dang ni rjes mthun par //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ni rjes mthun par //
translated: In accordance with meditative stabilization,

original: la sogs pa'i rkang pa drug gis gnas dang bsnyen pa ston pa la /🔽gnas ni rkang pa @8a * //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rkang pa drug gis gnas dang bsnyen pa ston pa la / gnas ni rkang pa @8a * //
translated: The six lines beginning with “place” teach the place and the service.

original: lngas ston te /
analyzed: lngas ston te /
translated: The place is taught with five lines.

original: zlas phye ba gnyis te /
analyzed: zlas phye ba gnyis te /
translated: There are two divisions:

original: bsnyen pa dang bsgrub pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: bsnyen pa dang bsgrub pa'i gnas so //
translated: the place of service and the place of practice.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bsgrub pa'i gnas bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bsgrub pa'i gnas bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the place of practice.

original: der chag chag skyang nul bya zhing me tog gis nyams dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: der chag chag skyang nul bya zhing me tog gis nyams dga' bar bya'o //
translated: There one should sprinkle and plaster the ground and make it delightful with flowers.

original: grogs bzang btsal la bsnyen pa brtsam //
analyzed: grogs bzang btsal la bsnyen pa brtsam //
translated: Having sought out good companions, one should begin the service.

original: zhes ba rkang pa gcig gis bsnyen pa bya bar dam bca' ba ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes ba rkang pa gcig gis bsnyen pa bya bar dam bca' ba ba stan pa'o //
translated: This one line teaches the promise to perform the service.

original: bdag dang sa gzhi yongs bsrung zhing //
analyzed: bdag dang sa gzhi yongs bsrung zhing //
translated: Fully protecting oneself and the ground,

original: la sogs pa rkang pa bzhis tshogs sogs pa'i bar chad bsrung ba ba stan te /
analyzed: la sogs pa rkang pa bzhis tshogs sogs pa'i bar chad bsrung ba ba stan te /
translated: These four lines beginning with “etc.” teach the protection against obstacles such as the accumulation of the accumulations.

original: rdo rje 'chang h'um mdzad du bsgyur la /🔽g-yas dang g-yon gser gyi rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa khro zhing rngam pa'i thugs kar ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um sngon po bsams la de las 'od byung bas rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang rab dang gur dang bla re dang dra bar
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang h'um mdzad du bsgyur la / g-yas dang g-yon gser gyi rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa khro zhing rngam pa'i thugs kar ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um sngon po bsams la de las 'od byung bas rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang rab dang gur dang bla re dang dra bar
translated: Vajradhara transforms into Humkara.🔽He holds a golden vajra in his right hand and a bell in his left hand.🔽In his wrathful and terrifying heart, he visualizes a blue Hum on top of a sun mandala arisen from Ma.

original: gyur par bsam mo //🔽rgyas pa la dga' ba rnams kyis ni /🔽sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'am /
analyzed: gyur par bsam mo // rgyas pa la dga' ba rnams kyis ni / sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'am /
translated: Light arises from that and becomes a vajra ground, fence, tent, canopy, and net.🔽Those who delight in increase should follow the Net of Illusory Manifestations or the Vajra Peak.

original: rdo rje rtse mo dag gi rjes su 'brang ba las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo dag gi rjes su 'brang ba las shes par bya'o //
translated: They should understand it from those.

original: 'dir ni bla ma'i man ngag bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bla ma'i man ngag bsdus pa'o //
translated: Here, it is summarized from the guru's instructions.

original: de nas shin tu brtser ldan pas //
analyzed: de nas shin tu brtser ldan pas //
translated: Then, with great compassion,

original: spyin sreg gis ni mnyes par bya //
analyzed: spyin sreg gis ni mnyes par bya //
translated: one should please with burnt offerings.

original: zhes pa rkang pa gnyis kyis tshogs sogs pa'i yo byad sprul pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa rkang pa gnyis kyis tshogs sogs pa'i yo byad sprul pa ston te /
translated: These two lines show the emanation of the materials for the accumulation, and so on.

original: de la spyir spyang zhing bsreg pa dang / so so'i sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyir spyang zhing bsreg pa dang / so so'i sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: In general, it is purified and burned, and blessed with individual mantras and mudras.

original: spyir spyang zhing bsreg pa ni rdo rje gnod spyin nam /
analyzed: spyir spyang zhing bsreg pa ni rdo rje gnod spyin nam /
translated: In general, purifying and burning is the vajra yaksha,

original: rdo rje rtse mo yongs su bzlas pa'i spos chus bsang gtor bya ba ni spyir spyang ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo yongs su bzlas pa'i spos chus bsang gtor bya ba ni spyir spyang ba'o //
translated: or the vajra peak. Reciting the mantra of the vajra yaksha, or the vajra peak, and sprinkling with perfumed water is the general purification.

original: rdo rje me'i sngags dang phyag rgyas mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsregs pa ni bsreg pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje me'i sngags dang phyag rgyas mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsregs pa ni bsreg pa'o //
translated: Burning impurities and so forth with the mantra and mudra of vajra fire is the burning.

original: so so'i sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab pa ni ;
analyzed: so so'i sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab pa ni ;
translated: Blessing with individual mantras and mudras is as follows.

original: til dang / nas dang / ku sha dang / 'bras yos dang / dri bzang po dang / me tog dkar po dang ldan pa'i mchod yon la sngon du rdo rje'i gar byas la rdo rje'i thal mo kha phye ba'i mchod yon gyi phyag rgya bcas la /
analyzed: til dang / nas dang / ku sha dang / 'bras yos dang / dri bzang po dang / me tog dkar po dang ldan pa'i mchod yon la sngon du rdo rje'i gar byas la rdo rje'i thal mo kha phye ba'i mchod yon gyi phyag rgya bcas la /
translated: For the water for welcoming, which is endowed with sesame, barley, kusha grass, parched rice, fragrant substances, and white flowers, first perform the vajra dance, and with the mudra of welcoming with the open vajra palms,🔽recite:

original: aom aa ra pa tsa na ya te na ma'am /
analyzed: aom aa ra pa tsa na ya te na ma'am /
translated: Oṃ, I pay homage to Arapacana.

original: aom badzra satva h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra satva h'um /
translated: Oṃ, vajra sattva, hūṃ.

original: lan gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gis byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: lan gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gis byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: One should consecrate with three, seven, or twenty-one [recitations].

original: de bzhin du me tog dang spos dang mar me dang dri dang byug pa dang lha bshos dang gtor ma la sogs pa rnams mi'i las 'das nas lha'i mchod rdzas khyad par can du bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog dang spos dang mar me dang dri dang byug pa dang lha bshos dang gtor ma la sogs pa rnams mi'i las 'das nas lha'i mchod rdzas khyad par can du bsam mo //
translated: Likewise, one should imagine that the flowers, incense, lamps, scents, ointments, food offerings, sacrificial cakes, and so forth, having transcended the human, are special divine offering substances.

original: de bzhin du spyin sreg la yang bza' ba zas kyi mchod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyin sreg la yang bza' ba zas kyi mchod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Likewise, in the case of the burnt offering, it is called the offering of food.

original: @8b gzhung bzhin du bsham zhing byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: @8b gzhung bzhin du bsham zhing byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: One should set it up and consecrate it as in the treatise.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa rab 'bad de //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa rab 'bad de //
translated: Having made effort in the prior approximation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang pa bco lngas rten gyi zhing sprul par ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang pa bco lngas rten gyi zhing sprul par ston te /
translated: In the fifteen lines beginning with these words, it teaches the emanation of the field of the receptacle.

original: de yang sngon du bsnyen pa zhes pa rkang pa bzhis rten gyi zhing nam mkha' la sprul par dam bca' bar ston la /
analyzed: de yang sngon du bsnyen pa zhes pa rkang pa bzhis rten gyi zhing nam mkha' la sprul par dam bca' bar ston la /
translated: Moreover, in the four lines beginning with “prior approximation,” it teaches the vow to emanate the field of the receptacle in space.

original: lag pa'i 'du byed ces pa rkang pa bcu gcig gis rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid kyi lus ngag yid kyi sbyor bas zhing spyan drangs pa ston te /
analyzed: lag pa'i 'du byed ces pa rkang pa bcu gcig gis rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid kyi lus ngag yid kyi sbyor bas zhing spyan drangs pa ston te /
translated: The eleven lines beginning with “the performance of the hand” show the yogin’s own body, speech, and mind inviting the field.

original: de yang bdag gi g-yas dang g-yon gyi sor mo la aom a'a:h'um tr'am hr'i:lnga bkod la /
analyzed: de yang bdag gi g-yas dang g-yon gyi sor mo la aom a'a:h'um tr'am hr'i:lnga bkod la /
translated: Moreover, having placed the five, oṃ, āḥ, hūṃ, traṃ, and hrīḥ, on the fingers of the right and left hands,

original: de nas mdzub mo gnyis mthe chung gnyis so sor mdud la de bkan la /
analyzed: de nas mdzub mo gnyis mthe chung gnyis so sor mdud la de bkan la /
translated: then the two index fingers and the two little fingers are crossed and extended.

original: aom badzra tsakra h'um zhes brjod cing byon par bsam mo //
analyzed: aom badzra tsakra h'um zhes brjod cing byon par bsam mo //
translated: Reciting oṃ vajra cakra hūṃ, one should imagine that they have arrived.

original: gang byon zhe na rigs lnga'am gcig gam drug gam rigs gsum mdun gyi nam mkha' la byon pa'o //
analyzed: gang byon zhe na rigs lnga'am gcig gam drug gam rigs gsum mdun gyi nam mkha' la byon pa'o //
translated: If one asks, “Who has arrived?” the five families, or one, or six, or the three families have arrived in the space in front.

original: gang gis byon zhen lus ngag yid kyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gang gis byon zhen lus ngag yid kyi sbyor bas so //
translated: If one asks, “By whom have they arrived?” they have arrived by the performance of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar mkha' la zhes pa rkang pa gnyis kyis bdag dang zhing du 'brel par bya ba ston te /
analyzed: de ltar mkha' la zhes pa rkang pa gnyis kyis bdag dang zhing du 'brel par bya ba ston te /
translated: The two lines beginning “Thus in the space” show the connection between oneself and the field.

original: mdun gyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha de rnams yang bems po lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: mdun gyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha de rnams yang bems po lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Those deities of the maṇḍala in front are not like inanimate objects.

original: rig pa can spyan rtsa rig rig pa snyan cha khrol khrol bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa can spyan rtsa rig rig pa snyan cha khrol khrol bar bsam pa'o //
translated: The eyes of the Vidyādhara are wide open, and the ornaments jingle.

original: dga' ba'i mchod pa glu yis bstod //
analyzed: dga' ba'i mchod pa glu yis bstod //
translated: The offering of joy is praised with song.

original: ces pa tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa lngas cho ga dag pa yan lag bcu'i sgo nas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba ston te /
analyzed: ces pa tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa lngas cho ga dag pa yan lag bcu'i sgo nas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba ston te /
translated: This teaches the accumulation of the collection of merit through the ten branches of pure ritual.

original: de yang dga' bas mchod ces pa rkang pa lngas phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba gdab pa dang /
analyzed: de yang dga' bas mchod ces pa rkang pa lngas phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba gdab pa dang /
translated: The five lines beginning “With joy, I offer” teach prostration, offering, confession of sins, rejoicing in all merit, and supplicating not to pass into nirvāṇa.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / bdag dbul ba dang / dngos grub blang ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang dgu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / bdag dbul ba dang / dngos grub blang ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang dgu ste /
translated: The five lines beginning “I request the Bhagavān” teach requesting to turn the wheel of dharma, to remain in samsara, to confess negative actions, to rejoice in virtue, and to dedicate merit.🔽The five lines beginning “I rejoice in the roots of virtue” teach the branches of rejoicing in the roots of virtue of all sentient beings, rejoicing in the roots of virtue of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, rejoicing in the roots of virtue of the hearers and solitary realizers, rejoicing in the roots of virtue of all sentient beings, and rejoicing in the roots of virtue of the buddhas.🔽The five lines beginning “I request the Bhagavān” teach requesting the buddhas to remain in samsara, requesting the bodhisattvas to remain in samsara, requesting the hearers and solitary realizers to remain in samsara, requesting the dharma protectors to remain in samsara, and requesting the buddhas to remain in samsara.🔽The five lines beginning “I rejoice in the roots of virtue” teach the branch of dedicating merit.

original: de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rjes su 'brang pa las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rjes su 'brang pa las shes par bya ste /
translated: These should be understood from the Root Tantra and the Net of Illusory Manifestations.

original: tshogs bcad sngags dang phyag rgyas me tog la sogs pa rnam pa lnga phul la /🔽aom badzra l'a skye h'um /
analyzed: tshogs bcad sngags dang phyag rgyas me tog la sogs pa rnam pa lnga phul la / aom badzra l'a skye h'um /
translated: Having cut the assembly, offer the five types, such as flowers, with mantra and mudra.🔽oṃ vajra lāsye hūṃ

original: aom badzra m'a le tr'am /🔽aom badzra g'i ti hr'i:/
analyzed: aom badzra m'a le tr'am / aom badzra g'i ti hr'i:/
translated: oṃ vajra māle taṃ🔽oṃ vajra gīti hrīḥ

original: aom badzra ni rt'i a'a:/🔽aom badzras tva su sam gra ham /
analyzed: aom badzra ni rt'i a'a:/ aom badzras tva su sam gra ham /
translated: oṃ vajra nṛtye aḥ🔽oṃ vajra puṣpe aḥ

original: badzra ratna ma nutt'a ram /
analyzed: badzra ratna ma nutt'a ram /
translated: oṃ vajra dhūpe aḥ

original: badzra dharm'a ka ya ne /🔽badzra karma ka rodbha be /🔽aom badzra dh'u pe h'um /
analyzed: badzra dharm'a ka ya ne / badzra karma ka rodbha be / aom badzra dh'u pe h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra mālya aḥ🔽oṃ vajra gandhe aḥ

original: aom badzra pushpa tr'am /🔽aom badzra a'a lo ke hr'i:/
analyzed: aom badzra pushpa tr'am / aom badzra a'a lo ke hr'i:/
translated: oṃ vajra āloke aḥ🔽oṃ vajra naivedye aḥ

original: aom badzra gandhe a'a:/
analyzed: aom badzra gandhe a'a:/
translated: oṃ vajra śabda aḥ

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa mchod pa brgyang kyis yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa mchod pa brgyang kyis yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Having made offerings with the full range of offerings, such as the goddess of charm, and so on,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta @9a * //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta @9a * //
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata

original: a'atna n'am ni ry'a ta na p'u dza spha ra na karma badzri aa /
analyzed: a'atna n'am ni ry'a ta na p'u dza spha ra na karma badzri aa /
translated: ātnanāṃ nirātanapūja spharaṇa karme svāhā

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'atma ni ni ry'a ta na p'u dza spha ra na karma a'a gi ra dza /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'atma ni ni ry'a ta na p'u dza spha ra na karma a'a gi ra dza /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata ātma nirātanapūja spharaṇa karme āgīrāja

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'atma nam nirya ta na aa nu r'a ga na p'u dza spha ra na karma b'a ne h'um ho //🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'atma nam ni ry'at nas s'a dhu ka ra p'u dza spha ra na karma tushti aa /🔽aom na ma:sarba tha th'a ga ta k'a ya aa bhi she kartne bhyo badzra ma ni aom /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'atma nam nirya ta na aa nu r'a ga na p'u dza spha ra na karma b'a ne h'um ho // aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'atma nam ni ry'at nas s'a dhu ka ra p'u dza spha ra na karma tushti aa / aom na ma:sarba tha th'a ga ta k'a ya aa bhi she kartne bhyo badzra ma ni aom /
translated: Oṃ, to the self-perfected, to the passionless, to the worshipful, to the one who performs all deeds, hūṃ hoḥ.

original: aom na ma sarba ta th'a ga ta s'urye bhyo badzra te dza ni dza la hr'i:/
analyzed: aom na ma sarba ta th'a ga ta s'urye bhyo badzra te dza ni dza la hr'i:/
translated: Oṃ, to the self-perfected, to the one who is the cause of the accomplishment of all aims, to the one who is worshipful, to the one who performs all deeds, to the one who is satisfied, aḥ.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a sha pa ri p'u ra na tsinta ma ni dhva dz'a gre bhyo badzra dhva dz'a gri tr'am /🔽aom na ma:sarba ta th'a ga ta ma h'a pra ti pra morya ka re bhyo badzra h'a sya ha /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a sha pa ri p'u ra na tsinta ma ni dhva dz'a gre bhyo badzra dhva dz'a gri tr'am / aom na ma:sarba ta th'a ga ta ma h'a pra ti pra morya ka re bhyo badzra h'a sya ha /
translated: Oṃ, homage to all tathāgatas, to the one who is consecrated in the body, to the one who is worthy of worship, to the vajra man, oṃ.🔽Oṃ, homage to all tathāgatas, to the one who is the sun, to the one who is worthy of worship, to the vajra light, jvala hriḥ.🔽Oṃ, to the one who is the banner of the wish-fulfilling jewel, to the one who is the banner of all tathāgatas, to the one who is worthy of worship, to the vajra banner, traṃ.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a nu ra ta badzra dharm'a ta sa ma ti /🔽bhistu no mi mah'a dharma gr'i dhi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a nu ra ta badzra dharm'a ta sa ma ti /🔽bhistu no mi mah'a dharma gr'i dhi /
translated: Oṃ, homage to all tathāgatas, to the one who is the great one who delights, to the one who is worthy of worship, to the vajra smile, ha.🔽Oṃ, to the one who is the vajra dharma of the realization of all tathāgatas, to the one who is the great dharma, to the one who is the bearer of the dharma, to the one who is worthy of worship, to the vajra dharma, dhi.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta bra dzny'a p'a ra mi ta ni ra ha ree stu no mi ma h'a gho sh'a nu ghe dham /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsakra aaksha ra pa ri bar ta dhi sarba s'u tranta na ye stu no mi sarba mandala le h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta bra dzny'a p'a ra mi ta ni ra ha ree stu no mi ma h'a gho sh'a nu ghe dham / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsakra aaksha ra pa ri bar ta dhi sarba s'u tranta na ye stu no mi sarba mandala le h'um /
translated: Oṃ, to the perfection of wisdom of all the tathāgatas, I pay homage with the great sound of the drum.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta sandha bha sha buddha sam ghi hi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta sandha bha sha buddha sam ghi hi /
translated: Oṃ, to the wheel of syllables of all the tathāgatas, which is the essence of all the sūtras, I pay homage with the maṇḍala of all. Hūṃ.🔽Oṃ, to the language of the buddhas and the assembly of the tathāgatas,

original: bhi yam stu no mi badzra badzre bam /
analyzed: bhi yam stu no mi badzra badzre bam /
translated: I pay homage with the sound of the bell. Vajra-vajra, vaṃ.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pa me gha spha ra na p'u dza karma ka ra ka ra /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpa pra sa spha ra na p'u dza karme ki ri ki ri /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pa me gha spha ra na p'u dza karma ka ra ka ra / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpa pra sa spha ra na p'u dza karme ki ri ki ri /
translated: Oṃ, to the smoke of all the tathāgatas, I pay homage with the action of the offering of the cloud of smoke.🔽Oṃ, to the flowers of all the tathāgatas, I pay homage with the action of the offering of the cloud of flowers. Kiri kiri.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a lo ke dzva la spha ra na p'u dza karma ba ra ba ra /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a lo ke dzva la spha ra na p'u dza karma ba ra ba ra /
translated: Oṃ, to the light of all the tathāgatas, I pay homage with the action of the offering of the cloud of light. Barva barva.

original: aom sarba ta ta th'a ga ta gandha sa mu dra spha ra na p'u dza karme ku ru ku ru /
analyzed: aom sarba ta ta th'a ga ta gandha sa mu dra spha ra na p'u dza karme ku ru ku ru /
translated: Oṃ, to the fragrance of all the tathāgatas, I pay homage with the action of the offering of the cloud of fragrance. Kuru kuru.

original: zhes bya ba sems dpa' bcu drug dang 'dra ba'i rig ma las kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sems dpa' bcu drug dang 'dra ba'i rig ma las kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the sixteen heroes together with the knowledge consorts who are like them, and the karmaconsorts, should make offerings.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni 'di rnams te /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni 'di rnams te /
translated: Their mudras are as follows:

original: rdo rje bsdams pa dkur gzhag ste bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa dkur gzhag ste bcings la /
translated: The vajra-binding is placed on the hip and bound.

original: gnyis su byas pa'i khu tshur gnyis //🔽bsgyings bcas gsor la gnyis ka yis //
analyzed: gnyis su byas pa'i khu tshur gnyis // bsgyings bcas gsor la gnyis ka yis //
translated: The two fists are made double.🔽With arrogance, they are brandished.🔽With both, one abides like holding a goad.

original: lcags kyu 'dzin ltar gnas pa dang // mda' 'phangs pa yin tshul dang ni //
analyzed: lcags kyu 'dzin ltar gnas pa dang // mda' 'phangs pa yin tshul dang ni //
translated: The manner of shooting an arrow,🔽and “excellent” is placed at the heart.

original: legs so zhes pa snying gar gzhag / dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gnyis //
analyzed: legs so zhes pa snying gar gzhag / dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gnyis //
translated: The consecration is the two vajras

original: snying gar nyi ma ba stan par bya //
analyzed: snying gar nyi ma ba stan par bya //
translated: placed on the seat of the sun at the heart.

original: g-yon pa la ni gru mo gzugs //
analyzed: g-yon pa la ni gru mo gzugs //
translated: The elbow is placed on the left.

original: de bzhin kha phyogs bskor bar bya //
analyzed: de bzhin kha phyogs bskor bar bya //
translated: Likewise, one should turn in the direction of the mouth.

original: g-yas pa yis ni g-yon par dbye //
analyzed: g-yas pa yis ni g-yon par dbye //
translated: With the right, one should separate the left.

original: snying gar g-yon pa ral gri mdud //🔽mgal me'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang // rdo rje gnyis ka kha nas dbyung //
analyzed: snying gar g-yon pa ral gri mdud // mgal me'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang // rdo rje gnyis ka kha nas dbyung //
translated: At the heart, the left is tied in a sword knot.🔽The whirling of a firebrand,🔽and the two vajras are expelled from the mouth.

original: rdo rje gar bskor bkrol ba yi //
analyzed: rdo rje gar bskor bkrol ba yi //
translated: The vajra dance is turned and released.

original: thal mo 'gram pa spyi bor gzhag / go cha mthe chung mche ba dang // khu tshur gnyis ni mnan pa'o //
analyzed: thal mo 'gram pa spyi bor gzhag / go cha mthe chung mche ba dang // khu tshur gnyis ni mnan pa'o //
translated: and press down with two fists.

original: de nas phyogs thams cad nas dkyil 'khor la yan lag lngas phyag btsal bar bsam zhing 'dis phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas phyogs thams cad nas dkyil 'khor la yan lag lngas phyag btsal bar bsam zhing 'dis phyag bya ba ni /
translated: Then, imagine that one prostrates to the maṇḍala with the five limbs from all directions, and one should prostrate with this:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'ak tsitta pra na me na badzra @9b bandha nam k'a ro mi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'ak tsitta pra na me na badzra @9b bandha nam k'a ro mi /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata kāya vāk citta praṇamena vajra bandha namaḥ

original: de nas phyag bzhi bya ste /
analyzed: de nas phyag bzhi bya ste /
translated: Then, one should prostrate four times:

original: 'di ltar shar phyogs nas rdo rje thal mo brkyang ba lus thams cad phab ste /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dzo pa stha n'a ya a'atma nam niry'a t'a ya mi /🔽sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra sa tv'a dhi tishtha sv'a m'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar shar phyogs nas rdo rje thal mo brkyang ba lus thams cad phab ste / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dzo pa stha n'a ya a'atma nam niry'a t'a ya mi / sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra sa tv'a dhi tishtha sv'a m'am /
translated: In this way, from the east, extend the vajra palms, lower the entire body,

original: zhes bya ba 'dis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis phyag bya'o //
translated: and prostrate with this:🔽oṃ sarva tathāgata pūjopaṣṭhānāya ātmanā niḥkhātayāmi🔽sarva tathāgata vajra sattva adhiṣṭhite svāṃ

original: de nas lho phyogs nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo snying gar spyar te /
analyzed: de nas lho phyogs nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo snying gar spyar te /
translated: Then, from the south, in the same way, extend the vajra palms to the heart,

original: dpral ba sa la reg par byas la /
analyzed: dpral ba sa la reg par byas la /
translated: and touch the forehead to the ground.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza aa bhi she ka ya a'atma n'am niry'a ta ya mi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza aa bhi she ka ya a'atma n'am niry'a ta ya mi /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata pūja abhiṣeka āya ātmānaṃ niryātayāmi

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra ratna aa bhi shinytsa mam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra ratna aa bhi shinytsa mam /
translated: sarva tathāgata vajra ratna abhiṣiñcāmi maṃ

original: zhes pa 'dis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis phyag bya'o //
translated: With this, one should prostrate.

original: de nas nub phyogs nas ji skad bshad pa bzhin rdo rje thal mo spyi bor gzhag ste khas la reg pa dang / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza pra brta n'a ya /
analyzed: de nas nub phyogs nas ji skad bshad pa bzhin rdo rje thal mo spyi bor gzhag ste khas la reg pa dang / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza pra brta n'a ya /
translated: Then, from the west, as was explained, one should place the vajra palms together at the crown and touch the mouth,

original: a'atma nam niry'a ta ya mi /
analyzed: a'atma nam niry'a ta ya mi /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata pūja pravartaya ātmānaṃ niryātayāmi

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dharm'a pra brta ya mam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dharm'a pra brta ya mam /
translated: sarva tathāgata vajra dharma pravartaya maṃ

original: zhes bya ba 'dis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis phyag bya'o //
translated: With this, one should prostrate.

original: de nas byang phyogs nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo spyi bo nas phab ste /
analyzed: de nas byang phyogs nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo spyi bo nas phab ste /
translated: Then, from the north, in the same way, one should lower the vajra palms from the crown

original: snying gar spyar la spyi bo sa la reg par byas te /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza karma ne /
analyzed: snying gar spyar la spyi bo sa la reg par byas te / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza karma ne /
translated: and touch the heart, touching the crown to the ground.

original: a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi /
analyzed: a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata pūja karmaṇe ātmānaṃ niryātayāmi

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra karma ku ru m'am /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra karma ku ru m'am /
translated: sarva tathāgata vajra karma kuru maṃ

original: zhes bya ba 'dis phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis phyag bya ba'o //
translated: With this, one should pay homage.

original: de nas me tog gi phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas me tog gi phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then, having formed the flower mudrā, one should say this:🔽“Whatever flower varieties there are,

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: whether in this world system or

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
translated: in all the world systems of the ten directions,🔽whether divine or human,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi me tog gi bye brag yid las byung ba'am /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi me tog gi bye brag yid las byung ba'am /
translated: whether born from the mind,

original: chu las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: chu las skyes pa'am /
translated: or born from water,🔽or born from the earth,

original: thang las skyes pa gang dag yod pa de dag rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thang las skyes pa gang dag yod pa de dag rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: all of them,

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to perform the activity of offering to all the tathāgatas without exception,🔽I offer to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas residing in the ten directions, together with the five families,

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and to all the special deities of the essence, mudrā, mantra, and vidyā mantras.”

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpe p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpe p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata puṣpe pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ

original: bdug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /🔽gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: bdug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: Form the incense mudra and say this:🔽“Whatever kinds of incense there are,🔽whether in this world system or in all the world systems in the ten directions,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi bdug pa'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi bdug pa'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am /
translated: whether of gods or humans, whether natural or compounded,

original: yang dag par spyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang dag par spyar ba'am /
translated: whether transformed or not,

original: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /🔽ma lus shing lus pa med @10a * //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste / ma lus shing lus pa med @10a * //
translated: all of them, without exception,

original: pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
translated: I offer to all the tathāgatas.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and to all the special deities of essence mantras, seal mantras, secret mantras, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pe p'u dza me ghas mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pe p'u dza me ghas mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata dhupe pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: mar me'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mar me'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Form the lamp mudrā and say this:🔽Whatever distinctions of light there are of gods and humans

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: in this world system,🔽or in all the world systems in the ten directions,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi snang ba'i bye brag yid las byung ba'am /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi snang ba'i bye brag yid las byung ba'am /
translated: whether they are lights arisen from the mind,

original: rin po che'i 'od dam /
analyzed: rin po che'i 'od dam /
translated: or lights of jewels,

original: mar me'i snang ba la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mar me'i snang ba la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: or lights of lamps, and so forth,🔽I offer them all to all the tathāgatas without exception

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to perform the activity of making offerings to them.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and to all the special deities of essence mantras, seal mantras, secret mantras, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a lo ke p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a lo ke p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ. All tathāgatas’ light offerings, the samādhi of the clouds of offerings, the perfection of offerings, I offer!

original: dri'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dri'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Form the mudrā of scent, and say this:

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: Whatever scents there are in this world system,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
translated: and whatever scents there are in all the world systems of the ten directions,🔽the particular scents of gods and humans,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi dri'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi dri'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am /
translated: whether innate,🔽or well-blended,

original: yang dag par spyar ba'am /🔽yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par spyar ba'am / yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: or transformed,🔽I offer them all to all the tathāgatas, without exception,

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod ba'i las bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod ba'i las bya ba'i phyir /

translated: All fifty-three deities invited from the natural maṇḍala enter into the heart of the principal deity of the pledge maṇḍala, Great Vajradhara.

original: spyi'i gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen po lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin du byin gyis @15a * //🔽brlab par bsam /
analyzed: spyi'i gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen po lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin du byin gyis @15a * //🔽brlab par bsam /
translated: Think that the consecration of the general principal, Great Vajradhara, is the nature of all the deities.

original: de nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs ka nas ye shes kyi lha tshogs 'thon te nam mkha' la gnas so //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs ka nas ye shes kyi lha tshogs 'thon te nam mkha' la gnas so //
translated: Then, the assembly of awareness deities emerge from the heart of Great Vajradhara and abide in the sky.

original: de nas sgos bkur ba'i gtso bo byin gyis brlab pa ni /
analyzed: de nas sgos bkur ba'i gtso bo byin gyis brlab pa ni /
translated: Next, the consecration of the principal ones of the retinue is as follows.

original: ae ma sangs rgyas thams cad ni //
analyzed: ae ma sangs rgyas thams cad ni //
translated: Amazing! All buddhas

original: rgya chen gdod nas skye ba min //🔽rdul phran ji snyed thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rgya chen gdod nas skye ba min // rdul phran ji snyed thams cad kyi //
translated: are not originally born from the vast.🔽All buddhas of as many atoms as there are

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni gcig tu gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni gcig tu gyur //
translated: become one.

original: zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: zhes brjod nas /
translated: Having recited that,

original: shar phyogs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi lha tshogs ni mi bskyod pa'i thugs kar zhugs te /
analyzed: shar phyogs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi lha tshogs ni mi bskyod pa'i thugs kar zhugs te /
translated: the assembly of awareness deities of the eastern direction enter into the heart of Akṣobhya.

original: mi bskyod pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: mi bskyod pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Akṣobhya consecrates them,

original: mi bskyod pa'i thugs ka nas slar 'thon te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i thugs ka nas slar 'thon te /
translated: and they emerge again from the heart of Akṣobhya.

original: rang rang gi dam tshig gi lha byin gyis brlab par bsam mo //
analyzed: rang rang gi dam tshig gi lha byin gyis brlab par bsam mo //
translated: Think that they consecrate the pledge beings of their respective directions.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs dang nub phyogs dang byang phyogs kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs dang nub phyogs dang byang phyogs kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The south, west, and north should be understood in the same way.

original: de nas dbang nod pa ni gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dbang nod pa ni gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: Next, the initiation is to be understood in two ways.

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyis dbang bskur bar bsam pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha la sgrub pa pos dbang nod pa'o ;
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyis dbang bskur bar bsam pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha la sgrub pa pos dbang nod pa'o ;
translated: Imagine that the empowerment is conferred by the pristine-awareness mandala upon the mandala of the pledge beings, and that the practitioner receives the empowerment from the mandala deities.

original: / dam tshig la ye shes kyis dbang bskur bar bsam pa ni /
analyzed: / dam tshig la ye shes kyis dbang bskur bar bsam pa ni /
translated: Imagine that the pristine awareness confers the empowerment upon the pledge beings.

original: rigs lnga la rin po che'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
analyzed: rigs lnga la rin po che'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that the five families are empowered with the jeweled crown and the silk ribbons.

original: de nas rigs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug mchod pa brgyang yum bzhi sgo ba dang sum cu rtsa gnyis la sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug mchod pa brgyang yum bzhi sgo ba dang sum cu rtsa gnyis la sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam /
translated: Then imagine that the thirty-two deities—the sixteen male and female families, the four female consorts, and the four gate guardians—are empowered with the jeweled crown and the silk ribbons of the five families.

original: bskal ba bzang po'i sems dpa' rnams la rin po che'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
analyzed: bskal ba bzang po'i sems dpa' rnams la rin po che'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that the bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon are empowered with the jeweled crown and the silk ribbons.

original: de nas sgrub po pos dbang nod pa ni /
analyzed: de nas sgrub po pos dbang nod pa ni /
translated: Then the practitioner receives the empowerment.

original: lugs gnyis te /
analyzed: lugs gnyis te /
translated: There are two traditions:

original: ye shes pa rnams dam tshig pa rnams kyi thugs ka nas slar 'thon te /
analyzed: ye shes pa rnams dam tshig pa rnams kyi thugs ka nas slar 'thon te /
translated: The pristine-awareness deities emerge from the hearts of the pledge deities.

original: gdan re re la snang ba gnyis kyi tshul du bzhugs pa la /
analyzed: gdan re re la snang ba gnyis kyi tshul du bzhugs pa la /
translated: Each of them sits on a seat in the manner of the two appearances.

original: sgrub pa po'i rig pa'i dbang lnga'am drug nos nas /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i rig pa'i dbang lnga'am drug nos nas /
translated: The practitioner receives the five or six initiations of knowledge.

original: dza:h'um bam ho: zhes brjod de slar thim par bsams pa'am /
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho: zhes brjod de slar thim par bsams pa'am /
translated: Saying “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” they dissolve back into the mandala.

original: yang na dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor chu dang 'o ma ltar gcig tu 'dres nas bzhugs pa la /
analyzed: yang na dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor chu dang 'o ma ltar gcig tu 'dres nas bzhugs pa la /
translated: Or else, the pledge mandala and the wisdom mandala mix like water with milk and remain there.

original: sgrub pa pos dbang nos par bsam mo //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos dbang nos par bsam mo //
translated: The practitioner imagines that he or she receives the initiation.

original: ye shes ba slar 'thon te nam mkha' la bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: ye shes ba slar 'thon te nam mkha' la bzhugs par bsam mo //
translated: The wisdom beings leave and remain in the sky.

original: de yang dbang gis dbang rtags ni /
analyzed: de yang dbang gis dbang rtags ni /
translated: The sign of the initiation is as follows:

original: sgrub pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa po yin na rin po che'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam /
analyzed: sgrub pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa po yin na rin po che'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam /
translated: If the practitioner is a reciter of the tathāgatas, he or she imagines that the initiation is conferred with a jeweled crown and silk ribbons.

original: sems dpa'i zlos pa po yin na /
analyzed: sems dpa'i zlos pa po yin na /
translated: If the practitioner is a bodhisattva reciter,

original: @15b de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
analyzed: @15b de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
translated: he or she imagines that the initiation is conferred with the crowns and silk ribbons of the five tathāgatas.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos byin gyis brlabs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos byin gyis brlabs pa ni /
translated: Next, the practitioner’s consecration is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa po yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa po yin na /
translated: If one is a Tathāgata actor,

original: yum rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas gnas bzhi byin gyis brlab par bsam mo //
analyzed: yum rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas gnas bzhi byin gyis brlab par bsam mo //
translated: one should imagine that the mother Vajradhātvīśvarī blesses the four places.

original: sems dpa'i zlos pa po yin na /
analyzed: sems dpa'i zlos pa po yin na /
translated: If one is a Bodhisattva actor,

original: sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa yum bzhis byin gyis brlab par bsam mo //
analyzed: sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa yum bzhis byin gyis brlab par bsam mo //
translated: one should imagine that the four mothers such as Vajradhātvīśvarī bless one.

original: de nas ye shes dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing pa dang dgyes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas ye shes dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing pa dang dgyes par bya ba ni /
translated: Next, the summoning, inducting, binding, and delighting of gnosis is

original: sgo bzhi'i sngags dang phyag rgyas gzhal yas khang gi nang du spyan drang ba ste /🔽de yang rdo rje lcags kyu'i sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas nang du bkug par bsam /🔽rdo rje zhags pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas bcug par bsam /
analyzed: sgo bzhi'i sngags dang phyag rgyas gzhal yas khang gi nang du spyan drang ba ste / de yang rdo rje lcags kyu'i sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas nang du bkug par bsam / rdo rje zhags pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas bcug par bsam /
translated: inviting into the interior of the celestial mansion with the mantras and mudras of the four doors.🔽Further, one should imagine that with the mantra and mudra of the vajra hook, [the deities] are summoned inside through each door.🔽One should imagine that with the mantra and mudra of the vajra noose, [the deities] are inducted through each door.

original: rdo rje lcags sgrog gi sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas bcings par bsam /
analyzed: rdo rje lcags sgrog gi sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas bcings par bsam /
translated: One should imagine that with the mantra and mudra of the vajra chain, [the deities] are bound through each door.

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas mnyes par bsam mo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas so so'i sgo nas mnyes par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that they are pleased by the mantra and mudra of Vajravesa.

original: de nas phyag rgyas rgyas gdab pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgyas rgyas gdab pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Then, the sealing with mudras is twofold:

original: rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa'o //
translated: extensive and concise.

original: rgyas pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba las shes par bya'o //
translated: The extensive should be understood according to the Net of Illusory Manifestations and the Root Tantra.

original: bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni /
translated: The concise is as follows:

original: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gdab pa /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gdab pa /
translated: Then, the sealing with samaya mudras:

original: sgrub pa bo'i snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams la /
analyzed: sgrub pa bo'i snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams la /
translated: At the heart of the practitioner, one should imagine a five-pronged vajra.

original: gtso bo'i sngags rings kyi mjug la /
analyzed: gtso bo'i sngags rings kyi mjug la /
translated: At the end of the principal mantra,

original: dri shya dza:h'um bam ho:sa ma ya stvam /
analyzed: dri shya dza:h'um bam ho:sa ma ya stvam /
translated: one should recite “driśya jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / samaya stvaṃ /

original: sa ma ya stvam /
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam /
translated: samaya stvaṃ /

original: aa ham manydzu shr'i /🔽zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: aa ham manydzu shr'i / zhes brjod pas /
translated: aham mañjuśrīḥ /🔽”

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gdab par bsam mo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gdab par bsam mo //
translated: By reciting that, one should imagine that all the deities of the mandala are sealed with the samaya mudra.

original: chos kyi phyag rgyas gdab pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgyas gdab pa ni /
translated: The sealing with the dharma mudra:

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi ljags kyi steng du h'um dkar po las yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa re chu rgyugs su yod par bsam /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi ljags kyi steng du h'um dkar po las yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa re chu rgyugs su yod par bsam /
translated: On the tongues of the mandala deities, imagine a white hūṃ that completely transforms into a five-pronged white vajra, like a water chestnut in size.

original: de'i lte ba la lha rnams rang rang gi sku skyed pa'i yig 'bru bkod la /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la lha rnams rang rang gi sku skyed pa'i yig 'bru bkod la /
translated: In the center of that, arrange the seed syllables that generate the deities’ forms.

original: chos kyi phyag rgyas rgyas gdab par bsam mo //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgyas rgyas gdab par bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that they are sealed with the dharma mudra.

original: las kyi phyag rgyas rgyas gdab pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgyas rgyas gdab pa ni /
translated: The mudra of action is as follows:

original: sgrub pa po'i snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la /
translated: At one’s heart is a vajra cross.

analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te / rdo rje'i gar dgu sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: Form the two vajra fists.

analyzed: phyag mtshan med par lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i khyer thabs bsgom pa ni /
translated: The way to meditate on the method of the great mudra of the deities without hand implements is preceded by the nine mudras of the vajra.

original: las kyi phyag rgyas rgyas gdab po //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgyas rgyas gdab po //
translated: This is the sealing with the mudra of action.

original: phyag mtshan med par lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i khyer thabs kyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni /
analyzed: phyag mtshan med par lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i khyer thabs kyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni /
translated: The way to form the mudra of the great mudra of the deities without hand implements is as follows.

original: de nas las @16a * //
analyzed: de nas las @16a * //
translated: Then, the action is as follows.

original: kyi phyag rgya bcing ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: kyi phyag rgya bcing ba 'byung ste /
translated: The arising of the binding of the mudras.

original: rdo rje khu tshur dam bcings te //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur dam bcings te //
translated: Having firmly clenched the vajra fists,

original: mnyam par gzhag pas gnyis su bya //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas gnyis su bya //
translated: one should raise them up equally.

original: rdo rje'i phyag rgyas gnyis bcings te //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phyag rgyas gnyis bcings te //
translated: Having bound the two with the vajra mudra,

original: de nas bcing ba rab tu bshad //
analyzed: de nas bcing ba rab tu bshad //
translated: then the binding is fully explained.

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rje mdzub mo ni //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rje mdzub mo ni //
translated: The left vajra finger

original: g-yas pa'i nang du bsgreng bar bya //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i nang du bsgreng bar bya //
translated: is raised up inside the right one.

original: byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya che //
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya che //
translated: This is the great mudra of supreme enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas byang chub spyin byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub spyin byed pa'o //
translated: bestowing the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: mi g-yo ba yis reg pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yis reg pa'o //
translated: The immovable one touches it,

original: rin chen gyi ni mchog spyin pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen gyi ni mchog spyin pa'o //
translated: the jewel makes the supreme gift.

original: tshe dpag med kyi ting 'dzin mchog / gdon mi za ba'i mi 'jigs spyin //
analyzed: tshe dpag med kyi ting 'dzin mchog / gdon mi za ba'i mi 'jigs spyin //
translated: The concentration of Amitāyus is supreme, the fearless gift of the invincible one.

original: de nas las kyi phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: de nas las kyi phyag rgya rnams //
translated: Then the karma mudras

original: mdor bsdus rab tu bshad par bya //
analyzed: mdor bsdus rab tu bshad par bya //
translated: are explained in brief.

original: rdo rje sems sogs sems dpa' rnams //
analyzed: rdo rje sems sogs sems dpa' rnams //

original: rdo rje las rnams byed pa ste //
analyzed: rdo rje las rnams byed pa ste //
translated: are the vajra actions.

original: bsgyings bcas gsor ba gnyis ka yin //
analyzed: bsgyings bcas gsor ba gnyis ka yin //

analyzed: legs so zhes pa snying gar gzhag / dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gnyis //

original: g-yon pa la ni gru mo gzugs //
analyzed: g-yon pa la ni gru mo gzugs //
translated: One should place the elbow on the left,

original: de bzhin kha phyogs bskor bar bya //
analyzed: de bzhin kha phyogs bskor bar bya //
translated: and likewise one should turn in a circle.

original: g-yas pa yis ni g-yon par dbye //
analyzed: g-yas pa yis ni g-yon par dbye //
translated: With the right one should separate the left,

original: snying gar g-yon pa ral gri mdud //
analyzed: snying gar g-yon pa ral gri mdud //

analyzed: rdo rje gar ni bskor ba yi //

analyzed: thal mo 'gram pa spyi bor gzhag / go cha mthe chung mche ba dang // khu tshur gnyis ni mnan pa'o //

original: rdo rje khu tshur tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur tshul gyis ni //
translated: With the manner of a vajra fist,

analyzed: bdug pa la sogs de bzhin spyin ; / sangs rgyas kun la mchod pa yi //
translated: Likewise, offer incense and so forth.🔽The one who performs the worship

analyzed: phyag rgya'i mchod pa byed pa po //
translated: with the seal of worship to all buddhas

analyzed: mdzub mos lcags kyu bcings pa ni //

analyzed: sgo gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa lnga'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings pa ni /

original: so so'i gtso bo bzhin du thabs re sgo re'am /
analyzed: so so'i gtso bo bzhin du thabs re sgo re'am /
translated: Like the individual principal ones, each method is at the door or

original: phyogs bzhir bcings pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir bcings pa'o //
translated: in the four directions.

analyzed: de rnams ni 'dir mang du spro mi dgos pa'i phyir mang du ma spros pa'o /
translated: Since it is not necessary to elaborate on those here, I will not elaborate much.

analyzed: // / de nas phyag rgya chen pos rgyas gdab pa ni /
translated: Next, the great seal is applied.

original: sgrub pa po'i snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams la /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams la /
translated: Visualize a five-pointed vajra at the heart of the practitioner.

original: @16b rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas //
analyzed: @16b rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas //

analyzed: de yang gong gi sa'i lha mo nam mkha' la aom badzra au pa ta ya zhes brjod la gdeg / de nas dong gi nang du chus bkang ste /

analyzed: me tog yang bcug la /

analyzed: de nas brkos pa'i sa de rdo rje gnod spyin gyi sngags btab pa'i spos chus bral brul du sprus la nang dgang bar bya'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis spyang ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis spyang ba ni /
translated: Purifying with samādhi is as follows:

original: slob dpon dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la /
analyzed: slob dpon dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la /
translated: The master sits in the center of the maṇḍala and

analyzed: rdo rje chen po nas gzhal yas khang la thug ba'i bar du bsgoms la sgo bzhi rta babs dang bcas pa'i nang du sa chud par bsgom par bya'o ;

original: / sa spyang ba'o //
analyzed: / sa spyang ba'o //

analyzed: de nas slob dpon lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas / sa phyogs 'di nyid du bdag rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor chen po bri bar bya'o zhes bsam pa sngon du btang ba ni /
translated: Then, the master, endowed with deity yoga,🔽should first think, In this very place I will draw the maṇḍala of Vairocana,

original: sems kyi dbang gis sa bzung ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis sa bzung ba'o //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par byas la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /

analyzed: aom badzra t'ikshn'a du:khatstshe da /

analyzed: pradzny'a dzny'a na m'u rti /

analyzed: dzny'a na k'a ya /

analyzed: b'a g'i shva ra /

analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na /

analyzed: ya te na ma / zhes zlos shing 'dug pa yan chad ni /

analyzed: slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin no //

analyzed: de nas bsgrub pa'i grogs mchog rigs bzhi'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa bzhis /

analyzed: bdag cag gis ni bstod pa yis //

analyzed: tshul chen yang ni rgyas par mdzad //

analyzed: mgon po khyod la gsol ba ni //

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor lo che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor lo che //
translated: the great wheel of all buddhas,

analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //

analyzed: bgegs tshar gcad par gsol ba gdab pa'o //

analyzed: de la mig byin gyis brlab pa ni /

analyzed: g-yas su ma las nyi ma g-yon du ta las zla ba /

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag rang nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag rang nyid //

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //

analyzed: stobs chen rdo rje can bdag nyid //

analyzed: bdag po rdo rje chen por bdag / byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'dor @20a * //

original: bgegs thams cad gsal btab par bsam /
analyzed: bgegs thams cad gsal btab par bsam /

analyzed: de ni rdo rje lta bas tshar gcod do //

analyzed: sa phyogs 'dir rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ngas 'bri yis ;

analyzed: rgan po dang / rgan mo g-yog dang 'khor du bcas pa /

analyzed: gang dag 'khod pa de dag dengs shig /'di ltar rdo rje 'chang gi bka' thos nas //

analyzed: de nas rkang pa'i sor mos rdo rje rtse gcig pas la 'bri zhing /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs bzhir rkang stabs bdun dang / lag stabs bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis bya ba ni /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor dag gi phyi rol du //

analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na grags pa yi // bkra shis la sogs gang yin rnams // dkyil 'khor bdag gi phyi rol du ;
translated: that is renowned in this world,🔽the wise one should place

analyzed: / phyogs bzhi dag tu mkhas pas dgod //

analyzed: yi ge brgya pa bzlas pa'i chus dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas phyi dang nang du bcas pa bsang gtor bya'o //

analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi dam tshig sems dpa'i sku gzugs lugs ma la sogs pa dkar po sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod la /

analyzed: rang gi snying pos bzhugs su gsol te /

analyzed: yig 'bru ni thams cad kyi ngo bo aa ste /
translated: The seed syllable is the essence of all, the letter A.

original: aa stong pa nyid las skad cig mas lhar dran par byas nas /
analyzed: aa stong pa nyid las skad cig mas lhar dran par byas nas /
translated: From the emptiness of the letter A, one should recollect the deity in an instant,

original: dge ba'i las rnams bya bar ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las rnams bya bar ba stan pa'o //
translated: and then perform virtuous actions.

original: de nas 'khor lo ba stan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo ba stan par bya // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then one should meditate on the wheel.

original: shes rab 'khor lor grags pa yin //
analyzed: shes rab 'khor lor grags pa yin //
translated: It is renowned as the wheel of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa ba stan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa ba stan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the meditation of the wheel of wisdom, from “Then one should meditate on the wheel” up to here.

original: dkyus nyid gsal ba'i phyir ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: dkyus nyid gsal ba'i phyir ma bkrol lo //
translated: It is not explained because the text itself is clear.

original: de yang shin tu zab pa dang / bla ma la rag las pa'i man ngag ston te /
analyzed: de yang shin tu zab pa dang / bla ma la rag las pa'i man ngag ston te /
translated: Moreover, it teaches the extremely profound esoteric instruction that depends on the guru.

original: de yang dang por bdag nyid khams dang zas snyoms par 'du @32a * //
analyzed: de yang dang por bdag nyid khams dang zas snyoms par 'du @32a * //
translated: First, one’s own elements and food are balanced.

original: 'dzi spangs la /
analyzed: 'dzi spangs la /
translated: Abandon busyness.

original: gnas bsam gtan gyi tsher ma med par skyil krung bcas la lag pa g-yon gyi steng du g-yas bzhag la dbang par bkan te /
analyzed: gnas bsam gtan gyi tsher ma med par skyil krung bcas la lag pa g-yon gyi steng du g-yas bzhag la dbang par bkan te /
translated: Sit cross-legged in a meditative state free of the thorns of distraction. Place the right hand on top of the left hand and straighten the body.

original: sgal ba'i steng du sgal ba gzhag la /
analyzed: sgal ba'i steng du sgal ba gzhag la /
translated: Place the spine on top of the spine.

original: mig sna gong du phab la so spyar la ma reg par byas la lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas /
analyzed: mig sna gong du phab la so spyar la ma reg par byas la lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas /
translated: Lower the eyes to the tip of the nose, and with the pride of being a deity, bite the upper and lower teeth without touching.

original: rtsa'i 'khor lo bzhi ye rang chas su lus la yod pa dkyus bzhin gsal btab la /
analyzed: rtsa'i 'khor lo bzhi ye rang chas su lus la yod pa dkyus bzhin gsal btab la /
translated: The four channel cakras exist in the body as primordial attributes.

original: de nas dang por lte ba'i 'khor lo la sems rtse gcig tu gtang la bsgom /
analyzed: de nas dang por lte ba'i 'khor lo la sems rtse gcig tu gtang la bsgom /
translated: Then, first focus the mind one-pointedly on the navel cakra and meditate.

original: de gsal nas de bzhin du snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / mtshog ma rnams rim gyis gsal bar bsgoms la /
analyzed: de gsal nas de bzhin du snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / mtshog ma rnams rim gyis gsal bar bsgoms la /
translated: When that is clear, meditate on the heart, throat, and head cakras in the same way.

original: de nas rkang pa dang / mdoms mer rlung dang me bsams te /
analyzed: de nas rkang pa dang / mdoms mer rlung dang me bsams te /
translated: Then, imagine the vāyu and fire at the feet and genitals.

original: rlung gis me sbar te rtsa g-yas na mar zhugs /
analyzed: rlung gis me sbar te rtsa g-yas na mar zhugs /
translated: The vāyu ignites the fire, which enters the right channel.

original: lte ba'i 'khor lo bde ba'i thig ler zhu /
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lo bde ba'i thig ler zhu /
translated: It melts the bindu of bliss in the navel cakra.

original: de bzhin du me rlung gis phul te snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / mchog ma rnams rim gyis bzhu nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du me rlung gis phul te snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / mchog ma rnams rim gyis bzhu nas /
translated: Likewise, the fire-wind blows, melting the heart, throat, and crown cakras in sequence.

original: lus thams cad bde ba'i thig les gang bar bsam zhing /
analyzed: lus thams cad bde ba'i thig les gang bar bsam zhing /
translated: Imagine that the whole body is filled with the bliss-drops.

original: blo bsam gtan gyi bde ba la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: blo bsam gtan gyi bde ba la gnas par bya ste /
translated: The mind should abide in the bliss of concentration.

original: me ni gnas der langs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: me ni gnas der langs so zhes bya'o //
translated: The fire rises up in that place.

original: de nas spyi bo'i ham las mes zhu bas thig le'i bde ba rtsa g-yon mar bab nas /
analyzed: de nas spyi bo'i ham las mes zhu bas thig le'i bde ba rtsa g-yon mar bab nas /
translated: Then, the fire melts the haṃ in the head, and the bliss-drop descends through the left channel.

original: dang por mtshog ma'i 'khor lo gsos te /
analyzed: dang por mtshog ma'i 'khor lo gsos te /
translated: First, it revives the cakra in the fontanel.

original: sngon bzhin du 'khor lo nyid du gyur par bsam mo ;
analyzed: sngon bzhin du 'khor lo nyid du gyur par bsam mo ;
translated: Imagine that it becomes the cakra as before.

original: ; de bzhin du mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba'i 'khor lo rnams rim gyis gsal bar bsam mo //
analyzed: ; de bzhin du mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba'i 'khor lo rnams rim gyis gsal bar bsam mo //
translated: Likewise, imagine that the cakras in the throat, heart, and navel are revived in sequence.

original: de ltar yang nas yang du rtse gcig gi sems kyis goms pas zhi gnas kyi bde ba skye bar 'gyur ba ni man ngag go /
analyzed: de ltar yang nas yang du rtse gcig gi sems kyis goms pas zhi gnas kyi bde ba skye bar 'gyur ba ni man ngag go /
translated: In that way, by repeatedly familiarizing the mind with one-pointed focus, the bliss of śamatha will arise.🔽This is the esoteric instruction.🔽As such, always meditate

original: 'di ltar rtag tu gang bsgom pa //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag tu gang bsgom pa //🔽zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, always meditate on this.🔽🔽

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi 'khor lo'i bsgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi 'khor lo'i bsgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
translated: Those are the samadhi of the cultivation of the wheel of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i phan yon ba stan te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i phan yon ba stan te /
translated: This passage teaches the benefits of the cultivation of the wheel of wisdom.

original: dkyus nyid gsal bas 'dir ma bkrol lo //🔽sangs rgyas kun ngang thabs cig pa'i //
analyzed: dkyus nyid gsal bas 'dir ma bkrol lo // sangs rgyas kun ngang thabs cig pa'i //
translated: Since the text itself is clear, I will not elaborate here.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: The text from “The single nature of all buddhas”

original: mi dpya dang mtshungs sems dang ldan par shog / des bya ba'i bar gyis slob dpon gyis ji ltar brtsams pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba ba stan pa ste sla bas de nyid kyi phyir ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: mi dpya dang mtshungs sems dang ldan par shog / des bya ba'i bar gyis slob dpon gyis ji ltar brtsams pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba ba stan pa ste sla bas de nyid kyi phyir ma bkrol lo //
translated: up to “May I have a mind equal to the sky” teaches how the master composed the text and the dedication of the roots of virtue. Since it is easy to understand, I will not elaborate here.

original: 'di bsdus dge rtsa gang yod des /
analyzed: 'di bsdus dge rtsa gang yod des /
translated: By whatever roots of virtue have been gathered here,🔽may I see the face of Manjushri.

original: 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi zhal mthong shog / gsang ba'i dka' 'grel bshad pa don bsdus sgron ma rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi zhal mthong shog / gsang ba'i dka' 'grel bshad pa don bsdus sgron ma rdzogs so //
translated: The commentary on the Secret Commentary, the Lamp Summarizing the Meaning, is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po de b'a ka ra tsandra @32b dang ; lo tsa ba klog skyas bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po de b'a ka ra tsandra @32b dang ; lo tsa ba klog skyas bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Devakara Chandra and the translator Lo-ka-wa translated it.
